cta.text: Learn how to link your new or existing HCP account to Vagrant Cloud.

blocks.heading: Use HCP Login for Vagrant Cloud
Get Started
blocks.subheading: Learn the command line utility for managing the lifecycle of virtual machines.

collectionCards.description: Vagrant isolates dependencies and their configuration within a single disposable and consistent development environment.
collectionCards.heading: Get Started

tutorialCards.description: Create your first development environment with Vagrant. This quick start provides a brief introduction to Vagrant, its prerequisites, and an overview of three of the most important Vagrant commands to understand.
tutorialCards.heading: What is Vagrant?

tutorialCards.description: Vagrant uses a base image to quickly clone a virtual machine. In this tutorial specify a base image.
tutorialCards.heading: Install and Specify a Box

tutorialCards.description: At this point you have a web server running on a Virtual Machine in your Vagrant environment. In this tutorial, use Vagrant's networking features to access the guest machine from your host machine.
tutorialCards.heading: Configure the Network

tutorialCards.description: In these tutorials your project was backed with VirtualBox. But Vagrant can work with a wide variety of backend providers, such as VMware, Hyper-V, and others.
tutorialCards.heading: Explore Other Providers

tutorialCards.description: Create a Vagrant box with Packer post-processors.
tutorialCards.heading: Post-processors - Vagrant

product.name: Vagrant

metadata.title: Vagrant by HashiCorp
metadata.description: Vagrant enables users to create and configure lightweight, reproducible, and portable development environments.

alertBanner.text: Our community conference is taking place in San Francisco and online October 10-12.

product.description: Learn to create development environments with Vagrant
